Amen, sir.

So said  Bob Koss  on  2003-02-07 --------------------

>On 2/7/03 12:34 AM, "Curt Sampson" <yahoo_sucks@...> wrote:
>
>> On Thu, 6 Feb 2003, J. B. Rainsberger wrote:
>> 
>>> Pushing every SQL statement you use out to a ResourceBundle (or
other
>>> metadata file) is a good idea.
>> 
>> Eww! I know this tends to be a bit of a personal preference, but I
far
>> prefer to keep my code together when I can. If a statement is used
in
>> only one place, keeping it where it's used makes the code much
easier to
>> read, because you don't have to go chasing off into some other file
to
>> find out what SQL statement is being executed.
>> 
>
>That's probably true if the SQL never has to change. If the schema
changes,
>I find it more convenient to go to one known place instead of having
to
>search my entire app for possible changes.
>
>-- 
>Robert Koss, Ph.D.     | Training, Mentoring, Contract Development
>Senior Consultant      | Object Oriented Design, C++, Java
>www.objectmentor.com   | Extreme Programming
